clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of Pulse Waveform Analysis-based Continuous Noninvasive Blood Pressure Measurement Sensor
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of Pulse Waveform Analysis-based Continuous Noninvasive Blood Pressure Measurement Sensor

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to define the sensitivity and specificity of a novel continuous noninvasive blood pressure monitor.

detailed_description.textblock: A novel continuous noninvasive blood pressure monitor is compared to invasive arterial measurement at postoperative care unit after a planned operation. Monitor captures also saturation and ECG, which are compared to traditional monitoring.

primary_outcome.measure: Relationship between invasive and noninvasive blood pressure measurement
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours of continuous measurement at PACU
primary_outcome.description: comparability of study monitor systolic, diastolic and mean blood pressure to invasive blood pressure measurement

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship between study monitor Sp02 measurement and current sp02 measurement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours of continuous measurement at PACU
secondary_outcome.description: comparability of measurements at several timepoints recorded as 10s intervals

arm_group.description: Vital values are being measured for the time of two hours at postoperative setting at postanesthesia care unit. A novel method is compared to golden standard: invasive measurement. Also Saturation measurements are being compared between standard and study monitor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- subjected to operative treatment with the need for invasive blood pressure measurement
- spontaneous ventilation
- able to give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- denial by patient
- pacemaker
